comments:
If you misspell the attribute label in a TOC XML file,
Tomcat blows up with an internal server error and very
little help about exactly what the problem is.  If topic 
or href are misspelled, it seems to handle these more 
gracefully.

Your plug-in is responsible for proving TOCs adhering to specs and testing it, 
but I agree that it would not hurt if help system could handle incorrent TOCs 
little better, and use log instead of showing exception to the user.  The draw 
back is that you will not know about the error while testing unless you look 
into the log.

Yes, the XML should be perfect ... and the Java compiler 
should expect perfect, error-free Java code.

It does handle some problems; as I mentioned, it seems
to handle the keyword topic or href, but it doesn't like
label.  Basically, it quits and I couldn't figure out
a way to recover, except shut it down . . . :-(

=====================
Similar to what you posted; problem seems to get
caught in TString.

Bob, we reconsidered and adding error checking for other plug-in files to help 
and decided it is undesired.

Help requires correct input.  Href attributes is optional, but if you misspell 
the mandatory label it does not exist.  This is a critical problem with your 
input files that we do not want to hide.  Another reason we do not want to fix 
this is that validating all TOCs that are read and assembled at run-time makes 
and impact on performance.  Misspelling the label is not the only way in wich 
TOCs can be broken.  You should do validation step during testing before the 
deployment of your plug-in.

For your purposes you can continue to work with help sytem, search synchronize 
to other books, or just refresh (press F5) to reload navigation.  You do not 
need to close the window.

We should handle this better than we do.  Two considerations:

   1) eclipse should handle these problems consistently.  It currenlty
      handles some XML problems without throwing internal errors.  Why
      not all????

   2) eclipse supplies no tools to validate the files.  The ones I used,
      and others, passed it.

1) Help does not perform validation at run-time.  href, topic is optional, 
label is mandatory attribute of topic.
2) Files can be validated against DTDs.  They are in 
eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help_2.1.0\dtd directory.

I'm not sure I follow the logic . . .  we handle
optional attributes but allow required ones to fail?

Well, think of a parser's behavior:
- if handles optional attributes/elements
- "fails" when a required attribute is missing
- "fails" when the documment is not well-formed, etc.

Since there is also a chance that null label affects help in other places than 
displayed navigation, and it might be difficult to debug, I released the code 
that checks for existance of label during parsing TOC.  If it is missing on a 
toc or topic, parsing that TOC (only) will fail and exception will be logged.
Fixed.  Help will not accept TOC with missing labels anymore.
